other_tests.findings: Left ventricular ejection fraction was 55%, normal size and function of atria and right ventricle.
Complete absence of perfusion to the right lung and multiple wedge-shaped perfusion defects at the left lung base.
No evidence of a residual thrombus in the proximal portion of the right pulmonary artery; arterial wall appeared abnormally thickened.
Composed primarily of an organizing thrombus with extensive chronic inflammation; no microorganisms present; no definitive features of active vasculitis identified.
Showed no reperfusion to the right lung.
